      int[] partition(Graph g, int k, java.util.HashMap props)
      returns an array of size g.getNumNodes() with values in [1,...,k] implements the Greedy K-way partitioning scheme (simplification over F-M style algorithms since it visits nodes randomly and makes the best move iff it leads to a gain>0, in terms of weight of cut-edges.)

        returns an array of size g.getNumNodes() with values in [1,...,k] implements the Greedy K-way partitioning scheme (simplification over F-M style algorithms since it visits nodes randomly and makes the best move iff it leads to a gain>0, in terms of weight of cut-edges.)

      • bestPart

        private int bestPart(Graph g,
                     int k,
                     int[] partition,
                     Node ni,
                     java.util.HashMap props)
        find the best partition that node ni can go to, or -1 if constraints are violated by this move. Also sets the best gain found in _gain.
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        k - int
        partition - int[]
        ni - Node
        props - HashMap
        Returns:
        int the partition block to move ni, or -1 else
